title: Ex-Yankees ace Masahiro Tanaka struggles in return to Japan
body: Former New York Yankees pitcher Masahiro Tanaka on his new uniform poses for a photo session during a news conference Saturday, Jan. 30, 2021 in Tokyo.All good things must come to an end. That includes  28-game regular-season winning streak in Japan.Tanaka made his season debut Saturday for the Tohoku Rakuten Golden Eagles, and it didn’t go as planned, giving up three runs and four hits in five innings with five strikeouts and a walk.Tanaka, who returned to Japan in January after completing a seven-year, $155 million contract with the , gave up a pair of home runs in the 4-1 loss to the Hokkaido Nippon Ham Fighters at the Tokyo Dome.The 32-year-old right-hander signed with Japan’s Pacific League over the winter after completing a seven-year, $155 million contract with the Yankees, getting a  from Rakuten.Tanaka was 78-46 with a 3.74 ERA for the Yankees and was 99-35 with a 2.30 ERA in seven seasons with the Golden Eagles.Last year, Tanaka went 3-3 with a 3.56 ERA during the -shortened 60-game  regular season.Note to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
